Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimization where the objective function and constraints are linear.
Example: Minimize cost subject to resource constraints

Name: Integer Programming
Description: Optimization where some or all decision variables are restricted to integers.

Name: Mixed-Integer Programming
Description: Optimization combining integer and continuous decision variables.

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: Optimization where the objective function is quadratic and constraints are linear.
Solvability: Polynomial time solvable for convex case

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimization where the objective function or constraints are nonlinear.

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Special case where the objective function is convex and the feasible region is a convex set.

Name: Combinatorial Optimization
Description: Optimization over a discrete set of feasible solutions.

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization under uncertainty with random variables in the constraints or objective.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Optimization by breaking down problems into simpler subproblems.
Solvability: Polynomial time solvable in many cases
